item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): Installation of a New Output Relay and a GND Switch
item.description:
During the testing of a restored Beogram 4002 (5513), I discovered an intermittent issue with the output relay. Occasionally, it wouldn’t activate when the stylus made contact, blocking the audio signal from the amplifier. This was a fortunate problem since the relay is the same one used for RPM switching in the 4002 and 4000 models. item.title: Beogram 4000: Cleaning the Carriage Position Switches and Fixing a Bent Output Switch Contact Tab
item.description:
During the restoration of a Beogram 4000, a process known as “switch day” involves cleaning the contacts of the many open switches. While some recommend desoldering the switches for thorough cleaning, it’s generally sufficient to clean the contact areas directly. This minimizes the risk of damaging the delicate contact tabs. Effective switch functionality hinges on clean contact points, not the overall appearance of the switch. The contact tabs should be straight and have adequate spring to ensure proper contact...
